newsArray.title: Desert Vipers hold nerve to edge Abu Dhabi Knight Riders in ILT20 thriller
newsArray.description: article author: Arab NewsSat, 2025-12-06 01:01SHARJAH: Desert Vipers made it two wins out of two in the DP World International League T20, as they held their nerve to secure a dramatic two-wicket victory over Abu Dhabi Knight Riders at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium on Friday.Shimron Hetmyer’s counterattacking 48 off 25 balls, and a late-order cameo from Khuzaima Tanveer, who hit 31 off just 12 deliveries, proved decisive as the Vipers weathered a tense finish to overhaul a target of 171.Main category: SportCricketTags: CricketT20 cricketUAEDP World ILT20Desert VipersAbu Dhabi Knight Riders
creator: daniel.fountain

newsArray.title: ILT20: Desert Vipers overcome Abu Dhabi Knight Riders in thriller
newsArray.description: Hetmyer brought his team back into the game with an impressive 25-ball 48 after a tough start, while Tanveer smashed 31 off just 12 in the death overs to secure the win
creator: Khaleej Times Staff

newsArray.title: There’s a hole in the wicket, dear Strikers: Bizarre scenes with WBBL match abandoned due to freak incident
newsArray.description: A freak incident during the change of innings caused umpires to call off a crucial WBBL match midway through the fixture after a hole emerged in the wicket. After Adelaide had posted 4-167 from their 20 overs at Karen Rolton Oval, an errant throw from Strikers allrounder Amanda-Jane Wellington during the warm-up rolled onto the [...]
creator: The Roar

newsArray.title: Aussies defend Bazball batting after Ponting hits out at reckless tactics: ‘Ugly, ugly dismissal’
newsArray.description: Australia took a leaf out of the Bazball book at stages of day two of the second Test with some of their outlandish shots but opener Jake Weatherald said the ends justify the means. Cameron Green and Alex Carey in particular were moving around in the crease to England’s quicks as they tried to establish [...]

newsArray.title: Another injury setback casts doubt over Hazlewood’s Ashes return
newsArray.description: Australia’s hopes of retaining the Ashes are set to take a hit with Josh Hazlewood on the verge of being ruled out for the rest of the series. The 34-year-old fast bowler was ruled out of the first two Tests due to a hamstring strain he suffered last month on Sheffield Shield duty for NSW. [...]
